title: CWE/SANS TOP 25 Most Dangerous Software Errors

SANS11.description:
CWE/SANS TOP 25 
Most Dangerous Software Errors

CWE-89.description: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

CWE-78.description: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

CWE-79.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

CWE-434.description: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type

CWE-601.description: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')

CWE-120.description: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

CWE-22.description: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

CWE-494.description: Download of Code Without Integrity Check

CWE-892.description: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere

CWE-807.description: Reliance on Untrusted Inputs in a Security Decision

CWE-732.description: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource

CWE-327.description: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm

CWE-307.description: Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts

CWE-759.description: Use of a One-Way Hash without a Salt
